channel.title: What would you like added to an operating system?
channel.description:
I was installing COD4 today and when the serial/key came up, i had the key copied to clipboard like xxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxx and it wouldn't let me paste it, id have to do each xxxx part 1 by 1. Normally i woulden't think of anything id like in a new operating system, but id like built in clipboard that holds more than 1 value.
Something like ctrl + C copies something to clipboard, when new text is copied, it moves the last clipboard text back a position, to paste you could use ctrl + f1. That would paste the newest value added, f2 would to the one before, f3 the one before that etc. Probably a max of 5 values would be nice, i know an application can do this but id rather not have a 3rd party application running when it could be integrated into a newer windows or something.
so What ideas have you came up that would be useful and is currently not in any operating systems?

item.title: What would you like added to an operating system?
item.dc:creator: @lawl lawl
item.description:
@lawl wrote:

after thinking it over, my suggestion would have to be porn

Read full topic

item.title: What would you like added to an operating system?
item.dc:creator: @sppt sppt
item.description:
@sppt wrote:

[quote=“bowserjr2, post:17, topic:267203”][quote author=sppt link=topic=352763.msg2706929#msg2706929 date=1237059331]

I want an OS that is able to run ALL windows games without a problem, yet is modular so you can disable EVERYTHING you don’t need.
But that’s rather hard to accomplish :\

windows 7 is modular…

Not as modular as I want it. At least, not yet.
[/quote]
And it can’t run all DOS games.[/quote]
(d)dosbox.

Read full topic

item.title: What would you like added to an operating system?
item.dc:creator: @Fat_Cookies Fat Cookies
item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

The windows 9x series was simply DOS with a graphic shell. I had a lot of fun with it because you could edit a system file, restart into command prompt and replace the original. I made some funny modifications to Windows 95 until I managed to cook up a BSoD but I simply re-installed.

Read full topic
item.source: What would you like added to an operating system?

item.title: What would you like added to an operating system?
item.dc:creator: @bootnecklad bootnecklad
item.description:
@bootnecklad wrote:

[quote=“Fat Cookies, post:7, topic:267203”][quote author=bootnecklad link=topic=352763.msg2705525#msg2705525 date=1236962936]
I’d like an OS where I have total control over EVERYTHING.
[/quote]
Thats just comunism.

I miss real DOS on Windows. If only NT Versions could have real DOS that you can boot into and is safe Winblows would be amazing.[/quote]
How can you have DOS on windows?

Read full topic

item.description:
@sanga282 wrote:

[quote=“frank_, post:2, topic:267203”]thats dumb

ea cd key inputs let you paste the whole thing in[/quote]
yeah and so do other companies aswell, CS4 let me so i guess Adobe would have that in all their products
but as for features in OS’? I dont really want an individual feature, i want apps to do the features the OS just needs to be able to provide a stable platform for running apps, browsing files and the like.
